    • Constructor Detail

      • LdapManager

        public LdapManager(java.util.Hashtable env)
            throws javax.naming.NamingException
        This prepare a jndi connection with a particular set of environment properties. At this point, the connection is not created, you have to call openContext to actually create the jndi connection.
        Throws:
        javax.naming.NamingException

      • LdapManager

        public LdapManager(java.lang.String url)
        This prepares the creation of a simple, unauthenticated jndi connection to an ldap url. Basic properties are set. Note that you have to call openContext to really create the connection.
        Parameters:
        url - a url of the form ldap://hostname:portnumber.

      • LdapManager

        public LdapManager(java.lang.String url,
           java.lang.String userDN,
           java.lang.String pwd)
        This creates a LdapManager object using simple username + password authentication.
        Parameters:
        url - a url of the form ldap://hostname:portnumber.
        userDN - the Manager User's distinguished name (optionally null if not used).
        pwd - the Manager User's password - (is null if user is not manager).

      • setupBasicProperties

        public void setupBasicProperties(java.lang.String url,
                        boolean tracing,
                        java.lang.String referralType,
                        java.lang.String aliasHandle)
        This sets the basic environment properties needed for a simple, unauthenticated jndi connection. It is used by openBasicContext().
        Parameters:
        url -
        tracing -
        referralType - could be: follow, ignore, throw
        aliasHandle - could be: finding, searching, etc.
        Throws:
        javax.naming.NamingException

        Parameters:

        Throws:

      • exists

        public boolean exists(java.lang.String nodeDN)
               throws javax.naming.NamingException
        Checks the existence of a particular DN
        Parameters:
        nodeDN - the DN to check
        Returns:
        the existence of the nodeDN (or false if an error occurs).
        Throws:

      • search

        public javax.naming.NamingEnumeration search(java.lang.String searchbase,
                                    java.lang.String filter,
                                    java.lang.String[] returnAttributes,
                                    int scope,
                                    int limit,
                                    int timeout)
                                      throws javax.naming.NamingException
        Method that calls the actual search on the jndi context.
        Parameters:
        searchbase - the domain name (relative to initial context in ldap) to search from.
        filter - the non-null filter to use for the search
        scope - the scope level of the search, one off "SearchControls.ONELEVEL_SCOPE
        limit - the maximum number of results to return
        timeout - the maximum time to wait before abandoning the search
        returnAttributes - an array of strings containing the names of attributes to search. (null = all, empty array = none)
        Returns:
        Throws:
        javax.naming.NamingException

      • getAttributes

        public javax.naming.directory.Attributes getAttributes(java.lang.String dn,
                                              java.lang.String[] returnAttributes)
                                                throws javax.naming.NamingException
        Gets all the attribute type and values for the given entry.
        Parameters:
        dn - the ldap string distinguished name of entry to be read
        returnAttributes - a list of specific attributes to return.
        Returns:
        an 'Attributes' object containing a list of all Attribute objects.
        Throws:
        javax.naming.NamingException

      • modifyAttributes

        public void modifyAttributes(java.lang.String dn,
                    int mod_type,
                    javax.naming.directory.Attributes attr)
                      throws javax.naming.NamingException
        Modifies an object's attributes, either adding, replacing or deleting the passed attributes.
        Parameters:
        dn - distinguished name of object to modify
        mod_type - the modification type to be performed; one of DirContext.REPLACE_ATTRIBUTE, DirContext.DELETE_ATTRIBUTE, or DirContext.ADD_ATTRIBUTE.
        attr - the new attributes to update the object with.
        Throws:
        javax.naming.NamingException

      • updateEntry

               javax.naming.directory.Attributes atts)
                 throws javax.naming.NamingException
        Updates an object with a new set of attributes
        Parameters:
        dn - distinguished name of object to update
        atts - the new attributes to update the object with.
        Throws:
        javax.naming.NamingException

        Parameters:

      • addEntry

        public void addEntry(java.lang.String dn,
            javax.naming.directory.Attributes atts)
              throws javax.naming.NamingException
        creates a new object (subcontext) with the given dn and attributes.
        Parameters:
        dn - the distinguished name of the new object
        atts - attributes for the new object
        Throws:
        javax.naming.NamingException

      • deleteEntry

        public void deleteEntry(java.lang.String dn)
                 throws javax.naming.NamingException
        deletes a leaf entry (subcontext). It is an error to attempt to delete an entry which is not a leaf entry, i.e. which has children.
        Parameters:
        dn -
        Throws:
        javax.naming.NamingException
